entries.title: Pair charged with hiding Russian oligarch's ties to yacht
entries.description: The Justice Department says two businessmen have been charged with trying to conceal a sanctioned Russian oligarch’s ownership of a luxury yacht seized in Spain last year by the U.S. government

entries.title: Elon Musk takes witness stand to defend Tesla buyout tweets
entries.description: Elon Musk has taken the witness stand to defend a 2018 tweet claiming he had lined up the financing to take Tesla private in a deal that never came close to happening

entries.title: Apple AirTags causing major security concerns over reports of stalking
entries.description: Apple's popular tracking device has been linked to alleged stalking cases, and prompted calls for improved safety.

entries.title: WATCH:  Bubbles instantly freeze amid plunging Siberian temperatures
entries.description: A family in Siberia was able to show off just how cold it was as bubbles turned into ice almost instantly.

entries.title: Chris Hipkins to be New Zealand's next prime minister
entries.description: New Zealand's Education Minister is set to become the island nation's next prime minister after the surprise resignation of Jacinda Ardern

entries.title: Bankman-Fried's lawyers say car hit barricade outside home
entries.description: A car with three occupants recently drove into a barricade outside the California home owned by Sam Bankman-Fried’s parents

entries.title: Woman accused of murdering, dismembering her parents
entries.description: Verity Beck has been arrested and charged in the murder and dismemberment of her parents. She faces four counts of murder and one count of possessing a murder weapon.

entries.title: Rare attack in Alaska renews interest in polar bear patrols
entries.description: A polar bear attack that killed a mother and her 1-year-old son in far western Alaska this week underscores the risks of living alongside the world's largest land carnivores and has renewed interest in prevention programs known as bear patrols

entries.title: Tech layoffs 2023: Companies that have made cuts
entries.description: Companies across the tech industry, including Vox Media, Amazon, Microsoft, and Google, have made major cuts in 2023.

entries.title: LGBTQ people, allies could face $1,500 fine in North Dakota
entries.description: As more than a dozen states consider passing anti-transgender legislation this year, North Dakota lawmakers are considering a bill that would penalize people with $1,500 fines for referring to themselves or others with gender pronouns different from th...

entries.title: Jamaica under scrutiny for fraud scandal that hit Usain Bolt
entries.description: An investigation into a private investment firm in Jamaica where $12.7 million belonging to sprinter Usain Bolt has gone missing has sparked criticism over how the government has handled the case

entries.title: WATCH:  Emily Ratajkowski gives commencement speech at Hunter College: ‘Joy is underrated’
entries.description: “Find the moments to pause, to reflect on where you are and how far you’ve come,” the model and author told the graduating class of 2023 at Hunter College in New York.

entries.title: 3 active-duty Marines charged in Jan. 6 Capitol riot
entries.description: Three active-duty Marines have been charged in the riot at the U.S. Capitol

entries.title: College dad sentenced to 60 years for sexually manipulating daughter's classmates
entries.description: Lawrence Ray, who sexually, psychologically and emotionally manipulated his daughter's classmates at Sarah Lawrence College, was sentenced Friday to 60 years in prison.

entries.title: Man charged in death of Oklahoma girl, 4, returned to state
entries.description: The man charged in the beating death of a 4-year-old Oklahoma girl on Christmas Day has been returned to the state

entries.title: WATCH:  Driver has near miss with van
entries.description: A driver pulling onto the road after a brief stop had a near miss with a van driving in the opposite direction.

entries.title: WATCH:  School bus erupts in flames on London street
entries.description: A school bus erupted into flames on a residential street in London. There were no reports of injuries, and all children on board were safely evacuated, officials said.

entries.title: Officers, paramedics to be arraigned in connection with death of Elijah McClain
entries.description: The police officers and paramedics involved in Elijah McClain's death are set to be arraigned Friday.

entries.title: Sen. Tim Kaine will seek reelection in 2024, bringing sigh of relief for Democrats
entries.description: Virginia is considered a must-keep seat for Democrats in 2024 with control of the chamber on the line.

entries.title: Tech industry job cuts come rapidly and in big numbers
entries.description: In just the past month there have been about 50,000 job cuts across the technology sector

entries.title: Man arrested after soaking homeless woman with hose
entries.description: A San Francisco art gallery owner was arrested Wednesday after he was seen spraying a homeless woman with water earlier this month, authorities said.

entries.title: Donald Trump withdraws lawsuit against New York attorney general
entries.description: Former President Donald Trump withdrew his $250 million lawsuit against New York Attorney General Letitia James on Friday.

entries.title: Wall Street appears headed for first weekly loss of 2023
entries.description: Premarket trading on Wall Street is mixed as recession fears threaten to drag major indexes to their first weekly decline of the year

entries.title: Romanian judge grants 30-day extension of Tate detention
entries.description: A Romanian official says a judge in Romania has granted prosecutors another request to extend by 30 days the arrest of Andrew Tate

entries.title: Gunman killed after open firing inside Walmart in Indiana, police say
entries.description: The suspect had a criminal history and was a former employee, police said.

entries.title: Trio of suicide drones strike US base in Syria, wounding 2
entries.description: Three suicide drones have attacked a U.S. base in eastern Syria, wounding two Syrian opposition fighters

entries.title: Google to cut 12,000 jobs from global workforce
entries.description: Alphabet Inc., the parent company of Google, said it will cut about 12,000 jobs from its global workforce, affecting approximately 6% of the company's employees.

entries.title: Woman assaults multiple flight attendants and cops with fire extinguisher at airport
entries.description: A woman has been arrested after assaulting flight attendants and police officers when she sprayed a fire extinguisher at them at one of the nation’s busiest airports.

entries.title: Soccer star Alves arrested in Spain after being accused of sexual abuse
entries.description: Brazilian soccer player Dani Alves has been arrested after being accused of sexually assaulting a woman in Barcelona

entries.title: T-Mobile breached by hackers as 37 million customers impacted
entries.description: T-Mobile says they discovered a "bad actor" was taking information through a single application, according to an SEC filing by the company this week.

entries.title: Protests move into Peru’s capital amid smoke and tear gas
entries.description: Thousands of protesters demanding the ouster of President Dina Boluarte poured into Peru’s capital, clashing with police who fired tear gas

entries.title: Indiana police kill shooter in Walmart, 1 person injured
entries.description: Indiana authorities say a gunman shot at police as he weaved through the aisles of a Walmart before officers shot and killed him

entries.title: Japan to lower COVID-19 to flu status, further easing rules
entries.description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida has announced plans to downgrade the legal status of COVID-19 to the equivalent of seasonal influenza in the spring, a move that would further relax mask wearing and other preventive measures as the country seeks t...

entries.title: WATCH:  Boston Dynamics robot showcases new skills
entries.description: Boston Dynamics put its humanoid robot's latest skills on full display.

entries.title: China keeping 1 hour daily limit on kids' online games
entries.description: As the week-long Lunar New Year holidays in China draws near, children have something more than just feasts and red envelop presents of cash to look forward to -– one extra hour of online games each day

entries.title: Judge fines Trump nearly $1M for filing 'revenge' lawsuit against Hillary Clinton
entries.description: A federal judge has fined former President Trump and his attorney nearly $1 million for filing what he deemed to be a frivolous lawsuit against Hillary Clinton.

entries.title: Singer-songwriter David Crosby of Crosby, Stills & Nash dies at 81
entries.description: Singer-songwriter David Crosby of Crosby, Stills & Nash & Young has died. He was 81 years old.

entries.title: Coroner says actor Leslie Jordan died of natural causes
entries.description: The Los Angeles County coroner's office says “Will & Grace" actor Leslie Jordan died from natural causes and not from a car accident last year

entries.title: T-Mobile says data on 37 million customers stolen
entries.description: U.S. wireless network T-Mobile says hackers have stolen data on 37 million customers

entries.title: Biden breaks silence on his handling of classified documents: 'I have no regrets'
entries.description: "There's no 'there' there," Biden told reporters when asked about the classified documents.
